IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: ORGANIZED TO DEVELOP, EDUCATE, AND NUTURE A STATEWIDE NETWORK OF PROACTIVE LEADERS FOR OKLAHOMA.
IRS990.MissionDesc: LEADERSHIP OKLAHOMA WAS ORGANIZED TO CREATE, INSPIRE, AND SUPPORT A DYNAMIC NETWORK OF LEADERS WHOSE INCREASED AWARENESS AND COMMITEMENT TO SERVICE WILL ENERGIZE OKLAHOMANS TO SHAPE OKLAHOMA'S FUTURE.
IRS990.Desc: LEADERSHIP OKLAHOMA CLASS PARTICIPANTS ENGAGE IN DIRECT INVOLVEMENT IN MEETING STATE LEADERS AND EXPLORING THE STATE'S PRESENT AND FUTURE OPPORTUNITIES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE MISSION OF THE ENDOWMENT IS TO PROVIDE SUPPLEMENTAL FUNDING FOR THE PROGRAMS OR PROJECTS OF LEADERSHIP OKLAHOMA AND TO PROVIDE BACK UP FUNDING DURING THE PERIODS WHEN NORMAL FUNDING IS INSUFFICIENT TO MEET THE OPERATIONAL NEEDS OF LEADERSHIP OKLAHOMA. ALL SUCH EXPENDITURES MUST BE MADE IN THE FURTHERANCE OF THE MISSION OF LEADERSHIP OKLAHOMA.

UNDER GENERALLY ACCEPTED ACCOUNTING PRINCIPLE IN THE UNITED STATES ("GAAP") GUIDANCE FOR INCOME TAXES, THE ORGANIZATION WOULD RECORD A LIABILITY FOR UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS WHEN IT IS PROBABLE THAT A LOSS HAS BEEN INCURRED AND THE AMOUNT CAN BE REASONABLY ESTIMATED. MANAGEMENT'S EVALUATION ON JUNE 30, 2023 REVEALED NO TAX POSITIONS THAT WOULD HAVE A MATERIAL IMPACT ON THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. THE ORGANIZATION IS SUBJECT TO ROUTINE AUDITS BY TAXING JURISDICTIONS; HOWEVER, THERE ARE CURRENTLY NO AUDITS FOR ANY TAX PERIODS IN PROGRESS. THE ORGANIZATION BELIEVES IT IS NO LONGER SUBJECT TO INCOME TAX EXAMINATIONS FOR YEARS PRIOR TO JUNE 30, 2020.

PERSONNEL COMMITTEE COMPRISED OF THE CHAIR, CHAIR-ELECT, AND IMMEDIATE PAST CHAIR REVIEWS THE PERFORMANCE OF THE CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER (CEO) AND RECOMMENDS COMPENSATION INCREASES, ADJUSTMENTS, AND/OR BONUSES TO THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE AND BOARD OF DIRECTORS. THESE RECOMMENDATIONS ARE USED WHEN PLANNING THE BUDGET. THE ORGANIZATION USES DATA COLLECTED BY THE OKLAHOMA CENTER FOR NONPROFITS ON NONPROFIT COMPENSATION TO DETERMINE THE RANGE OF THE SALARY OF THE CEO AND OTHER STAFF. HUMAN RESOURCE PROFESSIONALS ARE ALSO CONSULTED.

THE BONUS PAID TO MARION DURING THE YEAR IS BASED ON RECOGNITION OF HER PERSONAL PERFORMANCE AND ORGANIZATIONAL GROWTH. THE BONUSES ARE REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY LEADERSHIP OKLAHOMA'S PERSONNEL COMMITTEE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BOARD RECEIVES A COPY OF THE 990 FOR REVIEW. WRITTEN POLICIES DESIGNATE THAT THE AUDIT COMMITTEE REVIEWS THE RETURN PRIOR TO FILING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: BOARD MEMBERS ARE REQUIRED TO SUBMIT ANNUAL REPORTS ON POTENTIAL CONFLICTS OF INTEREST AND RESPOND TO QUESTIONAIRES. THESE ARE TRACKED BY STAFF TO ENSURE THAT ALL HAVE BEEN RECEIVED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: PERSONNEL COMMITTEE COMPRISED OF THE CHAIR, CHAIR-ELECT, AND IMMEDIATE PAST CHAIR REVIEWS THE PERFORMANCE OF THE CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER (CEO) AND RECOMMENDS COMPENSATION INCREASES, ADJUSTMENTS, AND/OR BONUSES TO THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE AND BOARD OF DIRECTORS. THESE RECOMMENDATIONS ARE USED WHEN PLANNING THE BUDGET. THE ORGANIZATION USES DATA COLLECTED BY THE OKLAHOMA CENTER FOR NONPROFITS ON NONPROFIT COMPENSATION TO DETERMINE THE RANGE OF THE SALARY OF THE CEO AND OTHER STAFF. HUMAN RESOURCE PROFESSIONALS ARE ALSO CONSULTED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, POLICIES, THE MOST RECENTLY FILED FORM 990, AND OTHER FINANCIAL INFORMATION IS AVAILABLE ON THE ORGANIZATION'S WEBSITE.
THE AUDIT COMMITTEE OVERSEES THE SELECTION OF THE EXTERNAL ACCOUNTANT TO CONDUCT THE AUDIT PROCEDURES OF LEADERSHIP OKLAHOMA'S ANNUAL FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.
